name: src/Camera.js
Camera
description: A simple wrapper for Three.js camera.

name: src/Ephem.js
Ephem
description: A class representing Kepler ephemerides.

params.name: initialValues
params.description:
A dictionary of initial values. Not all values
are required as some may be inferred from others.

params.name: units
params.description: The unit of angles in the list of initial values.

name: set
description: Sets an ephemerides attribute.

params.name: units
params.description: The unit of angle provided, if applicable.

name: get
description: Gets an ephemerides attribute.

params.name: units
params.description:
The unit of angle desired, if applicable. This
input is ignored for values that are not angle measurements.

name: EphemPresets
description: A dictionary containing ephemerides of planets and other well-known objects.

name: src/Orbit.js
Orbit
description: A class that builds a visual representation of a Kepler orbit.

params.name: ephem
params.description: The ephemerides that define this orbit.

params.name: options.color
params.description: The color of the orbital ellipse.

params.name: options.eclipticLineColor
params.description:
The color of lines drawn
perpendicular to the ecliptic in order to illustrate depth (defaults to
0x333333).

name: _ephem
description: Ephem object

name: _options
description: Options (see class definition for details)

name: _points
description: Cached orbital points.

name: _ellipse
description: Cached ellipse.

name: getPositionAtTime
description: Get heliocentric position of object at a given JED.

return.description: The ellipse object that represents this orbit.

name: getLinesToEcliptic
description:
A geometry containing line segments that run between the orbit ellipse and
the ecliptic plane of the solar system. This is a useful visual effect
that makes it easy to tell when an orbit goes below or above the ecliptic
plane.

return.description: A geometry with many line segments.

name: getHexColor
description: Get the color of this orbit.

return.description: The hexadecimal color of the orbital ellipse.

params.name: hexVal
params.description: The hexadecimal color of the orbital ellipse.

name: getVisibility
description: Get the visibility of this orbit.

return.description:
Whether the orbital ellipse is visible. Note that
although the ellipse may not be visible, it is still present in the
underlying Scene and Simultation.

name: setVisibility
description: Change the visibility of this orbit.

params.name: val
params.description: Whether to show the orbital ellipse.

name: src/Simulation.js
Simulation
description:
The main entrypoint of a visualization.

This class wraps a THREE.js scene, controls, skybox, etc in an animated
Simulation.

params.name: options.jed
params.description:
The JED start date for this simulation.
Defaults to 0

params.name: options.jedDelta
params.description:
The number of JED to add every tick of
the simulation.

params.name: options.jedPerSecond
params.description:
The number of jed to add every
second. Use this instead of `jedDelta` for constant motion that does not
vary with framerate. Defaults to 100

params.name: options.startPaused
params.description:
Whether the simulation should start
in a paused state.

params.name: options.maxNumParticles
params.description:
The maximum number of particles in
the visualization. Try choosing a number that is larger than your
particles, but not too much larger. It's usually good enough to choose the
next highest power of 2. If you're not showing many particles (tens of
thousands+), you don't need to worry about this.

params.name: options.debug.showAxesHelper
params.description: Show X, Y, and Z axes

params.name: options.debug.showStats
params.description:
Show FPS and other stats
(requires stats.js).

name: src/Skybox.js
Skybox
description: A class that adds a skybox (technically a skysphere) to a visualization.

name: get3jsObjects
description: A list of THREE.js objects that are used to compose the skybox.

name: getId
description: Get the unique ID of this object.

name: SkyboxPresets
description:
Preset skybox objects that you can use to add a skybox to your
visualization.

name: src/SpaceObject.js
SpaceObject
description: An object that can be added to a visualization.

params.name: options.position
params.description: [X, Y, Z] heliocentric coordinates of object. Defaults to [0, 0, 0]

params.name: options.scale
params.description: Scale of object on each [X, Y, Z] axis. Defaults to [1, 1, 1]

params.name: options.labelText
params.description: Text label to display above object (set undefined for no label)

params.name: options.hideOrbit
params.description: If true, don't show an orbital ellipse. Defaults false.

params.name: options.ecliptic.lineColor
params.description: Hex color of lines that run perpendicular to ecliptic. @see Orbit

params.name: options.ecliptic.displayLines
params.description: Whether to show ecliptic lines. Defaults false.

params.name: options.theme
params.description: Contains settings related to appearance of orbit

return.description: A div that contains the label for this object

name: setPosition
description:
Updates the position of this object. Applicable only if this object is a
sprite and not a particle type.

name: getPosition
description: Gets the visualization coordinates of this object at a given time.

name: update
description: Updates the object and its label positions for a given time.

name: get3jsObjects
description: Gets the THREE.js objects that represent this SpaceObject.

name: getColor
description:
Gets the color of this object. Usually this corresponds to the color of
the dot representing the object as well as its orbit.

name: getOrbit
description: Gets the {Orbit} object for this SpaceObject.

name: getId
description: Gets the unique ID of this object.

name: isStaticObject
description:
Determines whether object is static (can't change its position) or whether
its position can be updated (ie, it has ephemeris)

return.description: Whether this object can change its position.

name: SpaceObjectPresets
description: Useful presets for creating SpaceObjects.

name: src/SpaceParticles.js
SpaceParticles
description:
An efficient way to render many objects in space with Kepler orbits.
Primarily used by Simulation to render all non-static objects.

params.name: options.maxNumParticles
params.description: Maximum number of particles to display. Defaults to 1024

name: addParticle
description: Add a particle to this particle system.

name: update
description: Update the position for all particles

name: get3jsObjects
description: Get THREE.js objects that comprise this point cloud

return.description: List of objects to add to THREE.js scene

name: getId
description: Get unique id for this object.

name: src/shaders.js
src/spacekit.js
src/util.js
getFullTextureUrl
description: Returns the complete URL to a texture given a basepath and a template url.

name: ./README.md
